sentence.Network_en: Most tellingly, perhaps, chimpanzees do not draw as much information from the world around them as we do.
sentence.Network_cn: 也许，最能说明问题的是黑猩猩从周围的世界获取的信息没有我们多。

sentence.Network_en: But , tellingly, there was barely any exposure to exotic debt instruments.
sentence.Network_cn: 但很突出的一点是, 几乎没有任何对新奇债务工具的风险敞口.

sentence.Network_en: Her original vocation , tellingly, was not stay - at - home motherhood but wing journalism.
sentence.Network_cn: 她原先就在某左翼新闻出版界供职而 非 一位居家母亲,这很说明问题.

PerfectNetExp.abs: tellingly , the kind of project the Football Association have been struggling to build at Burton has been up , running and educating in Italy for over a century .显然地，这些项目的足球协会一直挣扎在伯顿已经建立起来，跑和教育在意大利超过半个世纪。

entry.def: The telling of a story or of something that has happened is the reporting of it to other people.

example.ex: Herbert sat quietly through the telling of this saga...
example.tran: 在聆听这个长篇传奇故事时，赫伯特自始至终安静地坐着。

example.ex: These stories grow in the telling.

entry.tran: 反映本性的;显露真实情况的
entry.def: If something is telling, it shows the true nature of a person or situation.

example.ex: It was her expression that was the most telling...
example.tran: 她的面部表情最能反映她的真实想法。

example.ex: How a man shaves may be a telling clue to his age.
example.tran: 看一个男人怎么刮胡子或许就能猜出他的年龄。

entry.tran: (论点、批评)强有力的，有说服力的
entry.def: A telling argument or criticism is a very effective one.

example.ex: He spoke reasonably, carefully, and with telling effect...
example.tran: 他说起话来合乎情理，措辞谨慎，而且说服力强。

example.ex: The most telling condemnation of the system was that it failed to fulfil its function.
example.tran: 对这一制度最有力的谴责是它没能发挥其应有的作用。

entry.tran: 无法预料;谁也不清楚;谁也说不准
entry.def: You use there's no telling to introduce a statement when you want to say that it is impossible to know what will happen in a situation.

example.ex: There's no telling how long the talks could drag on...
example.tran: 谁也说不准谈判还会拖多久。

example.ex: There's no telling what diseases a person can get.
example.tran: 无法预知人会得什么病。

sentences.sentence: "the plain manner of its style all the more tellingly points up the horror of the case"

auth_sentence.content: Perhaps tellingly, neither of his vanquished opponents had won before.
auth_sentence.res_content: Perhaps tellingly, neither of his vanquished opponents had won before.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Perhaps tellingly, neither of his vanquished opponents had won before.

auth_sentence.content: Tellingly for Hodgson, he was also second best to Barry throughout.
auth_sentence.res_content: Tellingly for Hodgson, he was also second best to Barry throughout.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Tellingly for Hodgson, he was also second best to Barry throughout.

auth_sentence.content: Tellingly, Wilde removes intimations of a prior attachment between Basil and Lord Henry.
auth_sentence.res_content: Tellingly, Wilde removes intimations of a prior attachment between Basil and Lord Henry.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Tellingly, Wilde removes intimations of a prior attachment between Basil and Lord Henry.
